title: When mapping function to Variable, the result seems anti-intuitive
body_html:
a = Variable(torch.IntTensor([-1, 1, 2]))
print a[0] > 0  #### Variable contains 0
print a[1] > 0  #### Variable contains 1
print filter(lambda x: x>0, a)  #### 

print map(lambda x: 1 if x>0 else 0, a)   #### [1, 1, 1] 
print map(lambda x: 1 if x>0 else 0, a.data)   #### [0, 1, 1]

How this happens?
body_text:
a = Variable(torch.IntTensor([-1, 1, 2]))
print a[0] > 0  #### Variable contains 0
print a[1] > 0  #### Variable contains 1
print filter(lambda x: x>0, a)  #### 

print map(lambda x: 1 if x>0 else 0, a)   #### [1, 1, 1] 
print map(lambda x: 1 if x>0 else 0, a.data)   #### [0, 1, 1] 

How this happens?
body:
```
a = Variable(torch.IntTensor([-1, 1, 2]))
print a[0] > 0  #### Variable contains 0
print a[1] > 0  #### Variable contains 1
print filter(lambda x: x>0, a)  #### 

print map(lambda x: 1 if x>0 else 0, a)   #### [1, 1, 1] 
print map(lambda x: 1 if x>0 else 0, a.data)   #### [0, 1, 1] 
```
How this happens?
